subject: Fashion
title: Microfiber Pollution Problem
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Microfiber Pollution Problem.

hook.text: Every wash of a synthetic jacket releases 700,000 tiny plastic fibers.

buildup.text: These microfibers pass through washing machine filters into rivers and oceans.

discovery.text: Marine life ingests them. They've been found in fish, salt, and tap water.

twist.text: Microfibers now outnumber microbeads as the top source of ocean plastic.

climax.text: Filter bags and coatings help, but no solution fully stops shedding yet.

punchline.text: Your laundry is polluting the ocean, one wash at a time.

quiz.question: How do microfibers reach the ocean?
